items.title: Trump’s AI executive order promises ‘one rulebook.’ Startups may get legal limbo instead.
items.summary: Trump signed an AI executive order targeting state laws and promising one national rulebook. Critics warn it could trigger court battles and prolong uncertainty for startups while Congress debates federal rules.

items.title: HBO Max’s new channels keep  Friends and Game of Thrones playing 24/7
items.summary: HBO Max is launching curated channels, a new feature that will allow you to quickly jump into a continuous feed of popular series or tune into a specific genre. When you select a channel on HBO Max, the streaming service will start you at the beginning of whatever's playing, while giving you the ability to […]

items.title: Companies are updating insider trading policies to cover prediction markets; Kalshi and others are pushing for federal oversight, including of insider trading (Rocket Drew/The Information)
items.summary:
Rocket Drew / The Information:
Companies are updating insider trading policies to cover prediction markets; Kalshi and others are pushing for federal oversight, including of insider trading  —  Over the past week, a handful of accounts on Polymarket, the predictions site, bet OpenAI would release a new large language model by December 13.

items.title: WFP secures 33 mln USD to support South Sudanese facing food insecurity
items.summary: JUBA, Dec. 12 (Xinhua) -- The United Nations World Food Program (WFP) on Friday secured 33.4 million U.S. dollars to assist tens of thousands of people affected by the worsening food insecurity and nutrition crisis across South Sudan. Read full story

items.title: Google Translate now lets you hear real-time translations in your headphones
items.summary: The real-time headphone translations experience keeps each speaker’s tone, emphasis, and cadence intact, so it’s easier to follow the conversation and tell who’s saying what.

items.title: Hundreds of storks found dead near Madrid amid wider bird flu surge
items.summary: MADRID, Dec 12 (Reuters) - Spanish authorities have detected four outbreaks of bird flu in wild birds in the central Madrid region, where forestry agents collected hundreds of dead storks over the past several weeks including more than a hundred in the past 24 hours. Read full story

items.title: Navee’s Christmas Sale drops GT3 Max e-scooter with 47-mile range to second-best $495 price (Save $205), more
items.summary:
Navee has launched its Christmas Sale with up to 30% discounts and bonus savings on its e-scooter lineup, like the GT3 Max Dual Spring Shock Absorber Electric Scooter at $494.99 shipped, after using the still active code BFVIP at checkout, which beats out Amazon’s pricing by $105. While it’s not as new or advanced as the XT5 Pro SuperScooter, the GT3 Max was released ahead of it back in July with a $750 MSRP that has since been cut down to $700. Discounts mostly kept costs above $620 without any direct bonus savings codes, and started increasing the savings last month during the early Black Friday sale when it dropped to $584, and then later the $490 low. If you missed out on that low price, you’re getting the next-best rate during this new event, courtesy of the $205 markdown. Head below to learn more and browse the entire sale’s lineup.

more…

items.title: Cherry’s regularly $179 wireless mechanical gaming keyboard with RGB just plunged to $42.50 (76% off)
items.summary:
Over at Amazon, you’ll find Cherry’s official storefront is offering its MX 8.2 TKL Wireless Mechanical Gaming Keyboard in white for $42.49 shipped. This particular model with the brand’s MX2A Red switches debuted around the same time last year, and has mostly been fetching its full $179 price. Today’s deal, however, delivers a whopping 76% discount on it, shaving $137 off its usual going rate. We saw the black variant of this keyboard with MX2A Brown switches drop to $50, but today’s deal steps things up with an additional $7 off. This is the lowest price we have tracked for this unit, and you can learn more about it below.

more…

items.title: Russia hits back at Europe's big plan to loan Moscow's frozen cash to Ukraine
items.summary: Russia's central bank says it is suing Belgium's Euroclear in court following an EU bid to use Russian assets to aid Ukraine.

items.title: EIB to boost lending for EU defence projects in 2026
items.summary: BRUSSELS, Dec 12 (Reuters) - The European Investment Bank, the EU's lending arm, will boost lending for defence projects to 4.5 billion euros ($5.28 billion) next year from 3.5 billion in 2025, and might revise the number even higher if there is more demand, EIB President Nadia Calvino said. Read full story

items.title: Home Depot exposed access to internal systems for a year, says researcher
items.summary: A security researcher tried to alert Home Depot to the security lapse exposing its back-end GitHub source code repos and other internal cloud systems, but was ignored.

items.title: South African authority intercepts human trafficking operations at OR Tambo Airport
items.summary: JOHANNESBURG, Dec. 12 (Xinhua) -- South Africa's Border Management Authority (BMA) has intensified its efforts to combat human trafficking, announcing two major interceptions of undocumented migrants at OR Tambo International Airport this week. Read full story

items.title: Morocco secures 270 mln euro loan from African Development Bank to upgrade airports
items.summary: RABAT, Dec. 12 (Xinhua) -- Morocco announced on Friday it has secured a 270-million-euro (about 317 million U.S. dollars) loan from the African Development Bank (AfDB) to finance an airport infrastructure modernization program. Read full story

items.title: Austrian former tycoon Benko will appeal fraud conviction, lawyer says

items.summary: JOHANNESBURG, Dec. 12 (Xinhua) -- At least two people were killed and several others trapped after a multi-story building under construction atop a temple collapsed Friday in Durban, South Africa, local authorities said. Read full story

Alongside the straight-up cash discount, which are also matched via the brand’s storefront at Amazon, Anker is stepping up with FREE gifts on orders placed through its site, plus extra savings on bundles and exclusive deals for members. If you’re looking to upgrade your charging setup or grab some last-minute gifts, now’s the time to jump in before these final holiday offers disappear.

items.title: Tis the season to save up to 65% on Anker SOLIX power stations during its Christmas Sale – deals start from $162
items.summary:
As predicted, today is the launch day for Anker’s SOLIX Christmas Sale with up to 65% discounts across its power station lineup, with many units returning to their Black Friday pricing – plus, there’s still some time to receive your orders ahead of the upcoming holiday. If you didn’t jump on any of the previous deals last month or for Cyber Monday, it’s a prime opportunity to score Anker’s SOLIX F3800 Portable Power Station at $1,998.95 shipped, which also matches the price we’re seeing over at Amazon. It carries a $3,999 MSRP direct from the brand, and while we occasionally see Amazon pricing pop up to that rate, it can more often be scored between $2,699 and $2,299 these days. We first saw this price appear during early Black Friday sales before dipping to the $1,799 low through Cyber Monday and climbing back to $2,400 after. Now, you’re getting a second opportunity to get $700 off the going rate (and $2,000 off the MSRP) for the second-best price behind that one-time low. You can also save a bit more by jumping on the exclusive deal for a refurbished F3800 station that we secured recently. Head below for more on this unit and all the other deals we’re seeing during Anker’s SOLIX Christmas Sale.

items.title: The Game Awards Amazon game sale up to 60% off: DK Bananza, Silent Hill f, Mario Wonder, AC Shadows, more
items.summary:
The 2025 Game Awards aired last night, with new world premieres for Star Wars: Fate of the Old Republic, a compile remake/re-imagining of the original Tomb Raider game, and all-new Tomb Raider Catalyst reveal, and a whole bunch more. A big congrats goes out to the Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 who absolutely dominated the awards part of the show, and is deservingly taking home the Game of the Year hardware for 2025, but for now we are focused on the Amazon Game Awards sale that is live for another 11 hours or so. We featured it last night on social, but there are still some wonderful deals up for grabs, including everything from actual console games to a whole host of battelstation hardware – we have sprinkled in a few other notable game deals landing this morning as well:

  • Donkey Kong Bananza Digital $59.50 (Reg. $70)
  • Donkey Kong Bananza + DK Island & Emerald Rush $76.50 (Reg. $90)
  • Super Mario Bros. Wonder $40 (Reg. $60)

  • ELDEN RING NIGHTREIGN $30 (Reg. $55)

  • Split Fiction – Nintendo Switch 2 $30 (Reg. $50)

  • And even more…
